title: The pandemic rekindled an old addiction ‚Äì to video games
description: In the depths of COVID-19 lockdown and dealing with a glut of free time, I penned an essay about struggling to stay away from an old addiction to video games.

title: The charter of rights can protect homeless campers. Is that enough?
description: A group of homeless campers in Vancouver was hoping the Charter of Rights and Freedoms could protect them from evictions. I documented a protest march they held in Coquitlam and wrote about their efforts to protect their community.

title: A city in trouble, a changing climate, and Canada's tightrope walk to fix both
description: Our glaciers are receding. Our arctic ice is melting. Our cities are flooding. As oil prices flag and the country fights with each other, one city on the border of Saskatchewan and Alberta waits for help. This project was completed as part of my Masters Research Project, and was created from scratch by me.

title: Scenes from a protest: Advocates storm Fraser Health to demand overdose prevention site
description: A group of advocates forced their way into the Surrey offices of Fraser Health, demanding action on building an overdose prevention site. I photographed the standoff that ensued.

title: Canada announces ban on industrial activities in marine protected areas
description: I wrote about a new ban on industrial activities in coastal areas that could work to protect marine ecosystems from human activity.

title: Indigenous design subject of new exhibit at Canadian Museum of History
description: At the opening of a new exhibit at the Museum of History in Ottawa, I brought my camera and interviewed the architect at the centre of it all.

title: The Canadian innovation that pulls drinking water out of thin air
description: A short story about a new Canadian invention that mimics lizards who can pull water from the air.

title: Thunder Bay Police Chief was hired despite survey indicating community's wish for an outsider: documents
description: A freelance story about how the police board in Thunder Bay ignored community wishes to hire from outside the current police force.

title: Ontario's pharmacy vaccines harder to find in some areas with high COVID rates
description: Using QGIS and Geopandas, we revealed gaps in Ontario's COVID-19 vaccine rollout using spatial data analysis.

title: Charges stayed in one of Ontario's largest Mob busts after alleged illegal conduct by investigators
description: York Regional Police excitedly announced one of the largest Mob busts in Ontario history. A year later, it all fell apart.

title: Drug possession charges dropped across Ontario at an unprecedented rate
description:
A year after being asked to drop simple drug possession charges, public data reveals that prosecutors in Ontario have been withdrawing charges at a rate never seen before.
I also produced this story for local Toronto radio.
embed: >CBC News - Withdrawals for Drug Possession Charges at Unprecedented Level

title: Base rate fallacy

title: Where are the Winnipeg police? We analyzed half a million service calls to find out
description: I analyzed more than 500,000 calls for service from the Winnipeg Police Service. I ran them through a custom geolocating script that placed each call into an election ward, then cleaned and analyzed the data to write the story.
